documentContentReferences.name: Screening Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the summary of changes for Section 1.3 to Section 8 for details on procedures at screening-only sites.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 2.3.1.1 regarding the COVID-19 pandemic to the specific risk assessment in Section 10.5.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 (Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy) to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation procedures.

documentContentReferences.name: Investigator's Brochure Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 and Section 4.2 to the Investigator's Brochure (IB) for study drug data.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Features Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 to Table 4, which describes the adaptive design features of the study.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Table Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 4 (Adaptive Protocol Features) to Table 7 for specific dose modification criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Exclusion Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 (Lifestyle Considerations) regarding blood donation restrictions to the exclusion criteria in Section 5.2.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Guidance Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 10.4 for details on appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Inclusion Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 (Lifestyle Considerations) regarding contraception start times to the inclusion criteria in Section 5.1.

documentContentReferences.name: SoA Reference for Discontinuation
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 and 7.2 to the Schedule of Activities in Section 1.3 for procedures upon study discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to Section 8.2.6 regarding pregnancy as a reason for discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: QTc Withdrawal Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: DISCONTINUATION OF STUDY INTERVENTION AND PARTICIPANT DISCONTINUATION/WITHDRAWAL
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.3 (Electrocardiograms) to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Lab Tests Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.4 (Clinical Safety Laboratory Assessments) to Section 10.2 for the list of required laboratory tests.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3 to Section 10.3 for detailed procedures on handling Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs).

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.3 (Follow-up of AEs and SAEs) to the definition of 'lost to follow-up' in Section 7.3.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.6 (Retained and Biobanked Sample) to Section 8.7, clarifying that samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: SoA Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references from sections 7.1, 8.5, 8.6, and 9.4.3 to the Schedule of Activities table for timing of various assessments.

documentContentReferences.name: Copper and Molybdenum Measurement Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.5 and 8.8 to Section 8.1.1 for details on copper and molybdenum measurements in various samples.

documentContentReferences.name: Pharmacodynamics Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.8 (Biomarkers) to Section 8.6 for details on pharmacodynamic assessments.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 9.3 to Table 8, which defines the populations for analysis.

commentAnnotations.text: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigatorâ€™s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: A cannula may be placed to minimize needle sticks; however, a catheter may not be left in place for longer than 72 hours and should be flushed a minimum of every 8 hours.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg
